about.description:
The HTCondor Python bindings aim to expose a high-quality,
Pythonic interface to the HTCondor client libraries. They utilize
the same C++ libraries as HTCondor itself, meaning they have
nearly the same behavior as the command line tools.

name: python-htcondor
raw_recipe:
# This file created by conda-build 3.18.11
# ------------------------------------------------

package:
    name: python-htcondor
    version: 8.9.3
source:
    patches:
        - boost-1.68.0.patch
        - paths.patch
        - python-archlib.patch
        - python3-libname.patch
        - python3.patch
        - rpath.patch
    sha256: 40c01d5284a610bc840c00ffaaf825a9b604e2f5ff4945390975d487c13782e8
    url: https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor/archive/V8_9_3.tar.gz
build:
    ignore_run_exports:
        - gct
        - libgcc-ng
        - pcre
    number: 1
    string: py38h3e4de3e_1
requirements:
    build:
        - _libgcc_mutex 0.1 main
        - binutils_impl_linux-64 2.33.1 he1b5a44_7
        - binutils_linux-64 2.33.1 h9595d00_15
        - bzip2 1.0.8 h516909a_1
        - ca-certificates 2019.9.11 hecc5488_0
        - cmake 3.15.5 hf94ab9c_0
        - curl 7.65.3 hf8cf82a_0
        - expat 2.2.5 he1b5a44_1004
        - gcc_impl_linux-64 7.3.0 habb00fd_2
        - gcc_linux-64 7.3.0 h553295d_15
        - gxx_impl_linux-64 7.3.0 hdf63c60_2
        - gxx_linux-64 7.3.0 h553295d_15
        - krb5 1.16.3 h05b26f9_1001
        - ld_impl_linux-64 2.33.1 h53a641e_7
        - libcurl 7.65.3 hda55be3_0
        - libedit 3.1.20170329 hf8c457e_1001
        - libgcc-ng 9.1.0 hdf63c60_0
        - libssh2 1.8.2 h22169c7_2
        - libstdcxx-ng 9.1.0 hdf63c60_0
        - libuv 1.33.1 h516909a_0
        - make 4.2.1 h14c3975_2004
        - ncurses 6.1 hf484d3e_1002
        - openssl 1.1.1d h516909a_0
        - pkg-config 0.29.2 h14c3975_1005
        - rhash 1.3.6 h14c3975_1001
        - tk 8.6.10 hed695b0_0
        - xz 5.2.4 h14c3975_1001
        - zlib 1.2.11 h516909a_1006
    host:
        - _libgcc_mutex 0.1 main
        - boost 1.70.0 py38h9de70de_1
        - boost-cpp 1.70.0 h8e57a91_2
        - bzip2 1.0.8 h516909a_1
        - ca-certificates 2019.9.11 hecc5488_0
        - gct 6.2.1550507116 he9ae1f9_1
        - htcondor-classads 8.9.3 he1b5a44_1
        - icu 64.2 he1b5a44_1
        - libblas 3.8.0 14_openblas
        - libcblas 3.8.0 14_openblas
        - libcondor_utils 8.9.3 hae2777f_1
        - libffi 3.2.1 he1b5a44_1006
        - libgcc-ng 9.1.0 hdf63c60_0
        - libgfortran-ng 7.3.0 hdf63c60_2
        - liblapack 3.8.0 14_openblas
        - libopenblas 0.3.7 h6e990d7_3
        - libstdcxx-ng 9.1.0 hdf63c60_0
        - munge 0.5.13 h1a52d62_0
        - ncurses 6.1 hf484d3e_1002
        - numpy 1.17.3 py38h95a1406_0
        - openssl 1.1.1d h516909a_0
        - pcre 8.43 he1b5a44_0
        - perl 5.26.2 h516909a_1006
        - python 3.8.0 h357f687_4
        - readline 8.0 hf8c457e_0
        - sqlite 3.30.1 hcee41ef_0
        - tk 8.6.10 hed695b0_0
        - xz 5.2.4 h14c3975_1001
        - zlib 1.2.11 h516909a_1006
    run:
        - boost >=1.70.0,<1.70.1.0a0
        - htcondor-classads 8.9.3 he1b5a44_1
        - libcondor_utils 8.9.3 hae2777f_1
        - libgcc-ng >=7.3.0
        - libstdcxx-ng >=7.3.0
        - python >=3.8,<3.9.0a0
test:
    commands:
        - python -m pip install --no-deps --index-url nothing htcondor
    imports:
        - classad
        - htcondor
    requires:
        - pip
about:
    description: 'The HTCondor Python bindings aim to expose a high-quality,

        Pythonic interface to the HTCondor client libraries. They utilize

        the same C++ libraries as HTCondor itself, meaning they have

        nearly the same behavior as the command line tools.

        '
    dev_url: https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor
    doc_url: https://htcondor.readthedocs.io/
    home: http://htcondor.org/
    license: Apache-2.0
    license_family: APACHE
    license_file: LICENSE-2.0.txt
    summary: Python bindings for HTCondor
extra:
    copy_test_source_files: true
    final: true
    recipe-maintainers:
        - duncanmmacleod
        - jasoncpatton

about.description:
The HTCondor Python bindings aim to expose a high-quality,
Pythonic interface to the HTCondor client libraries. They utilize
the same C++ libraries as HTCondor itself, meaning they have
nearly the same behavior as the command line tools.
